If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.3-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** N/A **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** daniel@onboarding94251.com **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** N/A **Issue reported by:** @danielrvidal **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#convert](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1756867511163679) ## Action Performed: 1. User clicks “Book Travel” in NewDot without validating their account. 2. The system displays an unclear error and does not show the expected OTP validation screen or even the same error as Classic: When verification is needed: | Classic | NewDot | |--------|--------| | | | Usually when the NewDot error shows, an Enable issue is created for Concierge but in this instance, it isn't. ## Expected Result: - NewDot should show the OTP code input screen and send the validation email. - Error messaging should align with other validation flows. - If validation fails, show the normal error message about OTP validation fails - Once validation is complete, proceed with the normal onboarding flow for Expensify Travel ## Actual Result: - Error is shown without resolution path. - No OTP email is sent. - No issue is created in the backend. ## Workaround: User must validate their account manually before attempting again. ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (blocked as real account credentials n/a) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @joekaufmanexpensify **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Convert ](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1757354025343179) ## Action Performed: 1. Go to NewDot > Workspace > Company Cards for a USD workspace 2. Add cards > US. 3. Selects Direct feed > Wells Fargo. 4. Follow the steps to connect in Wells Fargo with a real account. 5. Experience an API error in the Wells Fargo connection process. ## Expected Result: We bring the user back to NewDot/close the connection popup window and show an error page explaining that there was an issue connecting cards and to try again. We should make sure it works this way for all card feed connection types. The error page should recommend one of three followup actions for the user: try connecting to their bank later use the new Plaid import option use the Expensify Card ## Actual Result: We direct the user back to Expensify Classic, with no context. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Report name in preview doesn't update

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
# Problem The report name displayed in the Expense Report preview does not update when the policy name is updated and the custom report name formula references the policy name. Furthermore, I have verified that the front end receives the Onyx updates for the report name, and the new name is saved into IndexedDB, but the UI does not update. # Context There is some existing code in App today which attempts to set up optimistic report names. However, that code is very incomplete. We have this pull request which will be going out soon and it creates an entire system for computing optimistic record names [Reimplementation of Optimistic report names functionality](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69147#top). We also have this tracking issue for the frontend work, and the tracking issue for the entire project. - [ ] https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/59689 - [ ] https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/44340 You should not need total knowledge of that system in order to fix this bug, but it is something to keep in mind when finding the root cause and determining the best way to fix this issue. ## Test steps The setup and test steps are copied from the [manual testing document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1q6T1rOSgGu6H29a5TdnW5obvvkAiGE5QeDtlayWNxw8/edit?usp=sharing). We are only running some of the test steps, to keep this issue focused. **Set up** 1. Create a new account for testing report formulas, or use one that’s already been set up 3. Sign in to [staging.expensify.com/inbox](http://staging.expensify.com/inbox) with the test account 4. Open the JS console (command + option + j), paste in this snippet, and press enter to run it `SSetNameValuePair('useCustomReportNamesNewExpensify', 'true');` 5. Reload the page 6. Paste this snippet and hit enter `g_account.nameValuePairs.useCustomReportNamesNewExpensify;`, and verify it returns ’true’ 7. Log in on New Expensify 8. Create a workspace 9. Create a manual expense on the workspace **Test Policy level formula {report:policyName}** 1. Go to workspace settings > Overview 2. Update the name to “Formula test” 3. Go to the workspace settings > Report 4. Select the “Default report title” 5. Enter “Report from {report:policyName}” and save it 6. Verify the report name is updated to “Report from Formula test” 7. Update the workspace name to “Formula test 1” 8. Verify the report name is updated to “Report from Formula test 1” 2. Run the test case [Policy level formula {report:policyName}](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1q6T1rOSgGu6H29a5TdnW5obvvkAiGE5QeDtlayWNxw8/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.mkwknz8vj8rn) ## Actual result After updating the policy/workspace name the expense report preview does not show the updated report name ## Expected result It shows the updated report name without having to open the report # Solution Investigate the root cause, likely something causing the data to not update directly when the value from Onyx changes.
Upwork Automation - Do Not Edit

  • Upwork Job ID: 1965127691112050927
  • Last Price Increase: 2025-09-08

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.2-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-702/folder/13176791/41237173/881813696 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** applausetester+eyi123@applause.expensifail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Sign in with an expensifail account 2. Create a workspace with Delay submission disabled and Add approvals enabled 3. Submit a manual expense in workspace chat 4. Create an empty report (Report 2) 5. Split the expense previously created in the workspace chat into 2 child splits 6. Select one of the splits and move it to the empty report (Report 2) 7. Submit and approve Report 2 8. Open the other split expense in Report 1 > Click on More ## Expected Result: Split option should be there and the expense can be split ## Actual Result: There is no split option and the expense can't be split ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.2-4 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @neil-marcellini **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Product ](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1757099072111629) ## Action Performed: 1. Open a reported expense on NewDot 2. Attempt to update the amount to $0 → it is not allowed 3. Switch to OldDot and update the same expense amount to $0 → update is successful 4. Return to NewDot and view the expense → it still shows the original amount, not $0 ## Expected Result: Both NewDot and OldDot should allow updating a cash or personal card expense transaction to $0 consistently when editing an expense amount is allowed. ## Actual Result: NewDot disallows updating to $0. An error message is displayed as `Please enter a valid amount before continuing`, yet OldDot allows it. Further, after updating an amount to $0 in OldDot, NewDot shows the original amount incorrectly. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: [$250] Tighten the onyx export masking logic

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
From [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C08CZDJFJ77/p1755699468779659) ### Background Currently some fields are left behind in state masking which is a security vulnerability. We need to make sure that no private information is shared when exporting one's Onyx state through Troubleshoot. ### Problem When users export their Onyx state through the Troubleshoot feature, sensitive personal data remains visible in the exported text files, which creates a security vulnerability that could lead to unauthorized account access. ### Solution Expand the masking rules so that no private information is shared when exporting one’s Onyx state through Troubleshoot. You can find the list of keys in attached file. This is not sensitive information per se, but its not needed for the purpose of exporting the onyx state so we can mask it
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @hungvu193
